posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If you have not given up Wizard completely, the Melee Mage is a way to build and play.

My advice for a sorcerer is to go pure sorcerer pre epic to build up spellpower. Start with a high charisma (18) and then some constitution (14). That gives you some points to spend on strength. The most important skills are spellcraft and concentration. As human you will get both with an intelligence of 8.
Stay out of hand-to-hand combat in the early levels. Hang back with a crossbow early on and use your familiar, summoned animals or henchmen as meat-shields.
At level 10 when you have some level 4 spells (Improved invisibility, Stoneskin, Ice storm) and start getting level 5 spells (firebrand) , soloing becomes easy.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
As for you original request, you won't see many builds for the OC specifically because the environment generally is considered easy for the most part and it does not go all the way to Epic levels.

that being said, the OC as the HoTU after that is a lot friendly to the traditional Hero so Paladin's are very good for that (also because of their skill selection) and a perfect match for your Sorcerer too.

Being simplistic here i will say that if you want to take your Hero all the way up to HoTU which ends at lvl 27 or so, a Sorcerer 23/ Paladin 4 with DM & DS is a really good way to go.

Keep Persuade, Tumble, Spellcraft and Concentration high and you will have no problem at all. Knock,find traps and your Pixie will take care of all your Rogue needs.

Enjoy.
